think of who Luke calling Chopper his

massive chakra sayin superhuman Etc now
as the Pinnacle of strength kaido

Offspring like big mom with many of her

strong it can always be attributed to

parents as is the case with Ace having a

strength is almost always based on what

but is training with Garb Ace and Sabo
shaped him to be the PowerHouse he was
when he set off and the same can be said

process in real time with a silly
example like helmeppo who was much
weaker than his father to the point
where a weakling like Kobe at the start
of the series can match him but through

much stronger even surpassing his father
now Yamato wasn't just strong because

was beaten into shape by the strongest

even acknowledges that she's as strong
as she is today because of him putting

there's no shortage of cases of strong

be fully explained with just their
upbringing rather than their genetics to
tie this back to Zoro though because
that's why we're here this was all to
say that not only azora's strength not
because of his lineage but in fact that
had absolutely nothing to do with it his
parents and grandparents shout out to
pinzar were just normal people as far as
we know the source of Zora's strength
can actually be traced down to two key
things in his life one his ambition and
two his promise to Queen his ambition
can be directly tied to Conker's hockey
and was what initially motivated him to
be stronger now as the name suggests to
adamantly aspire to be the best at
something generally tends to be
consistent with people who have
conquerors hockey but this alone isn't
enough to set Zoro up for greatness in
fact I'd argue that without his
encounter with kuina zor would have
never amounted to something just like
Luffy without Shanks would have had a
drastically different path in life a
bold claim for sure but let's explore it
further many people forget a small
aspect of zoro's character but he more
than any other Straw Hat seems to be
very fixated on promises he would not
even shut up about the promise this and
promise that in his introduction and he
puts huge value again on promises he
holds promises to a sacred degree where
he even believed how mepo to keep his
word and release him eventually but now
looking back on Zora's most important
vow of his life which is when queena
died he specifically says that he will
work for kuyina's share too someone who
outclassed him in every way meaning that
Zora can no longer carry on and train
like he did before carrying Karina on
with him through her sword meant that he
will not only reach the best version he
could be of himself but simultaneously
the best version kawina could have been
as well he is now carrying the weight of
two conqueror worthy Ambitions with him
and as we established before he is above
all else a man who keeps his promises
this is the biggest motivator and the
reason why Zoro trains excessively
throughout the story more than anyone
else while his ambition fueled his
natural aptitude in Congress hockey his
encounter and promise to his friend is
what fuels his actual combat power being
a descendant of ryuma is cool but it has
no bearing whatsoever on his power and
purely serves as an irony of Fate as Oda
loves to always do it does however has
everything to do with not only his time
in shimotsuki Village but also his
Fateful Encounter With Luffy Luffy was
the final vessel Zoro needed to broaden
his own Horizon and rapidly grow Beyond
East blue it is no stretch to say that
the two biggest factors for Zora
becoming as strong as he is were the two
main promises in his life the promises
to kuina and Luffy the very true people
Oda decided to include when revisiting
zoro's origin during the King fight so I
know it's easy to look at Zoro and now
Trace things back to his lineage and say
Well zoro's only strong because he's
connected to ryuma the sword God of
course he's going to be strong but
that's dismissing everything that's come
before us in the story Otis set up in
regards to Zora's promises and how
important this is to zoro's ambition so
growth and overall zoro's character so
if you are a zoraphan a true Zora fan
think about what you're saying when you
try to undermine zoro's Ambitions and
zoro's goals because his very existence
is based off of the things established
before zor would have been strong
regardless of his ancestors as long as
he met these two people and went through
the things that he did there are few
people with the medal and ambition that
Zorro has and we see that time and time
again that he's willing to do whatever
it takes to fulfill his promise to Luffy
even throwing away his own Pride so Zoro
with this is not necessarily a unique
character when it comes to strength for
others which is some of the theme of the
straw hats doing and becoming whatever
it takes for your friends like Nico
Robin becoming the devil that it took
for her friend Sanji literally becoming
the germa tech for their friends Chopper
becoming the monster for their friends
Frankie becoming a cyborg for their
friends Brooke literally dying and
leaving his body for his friends it is a
theme within the straw hats and Zoro
embodies that in which he is willing to
do whatever for his friends especially
for his Captain because like I stated
before promises are Paramount that's why
he talks Luffy about hey we're in a new
world you promised me you would take
this seriously you promised this would
never happen again can we do that can we
fulfill and follow through on the things
we believe in in Zoro that what it means
to him as a character because of that
his strength is not predicated on some
old guy that died years ago this is
about Zorro and his Ambitions and the
people he's met and his experiences and
guys I stand by that
